introduction: Lightning is like a super hero movie. The best scenes come when the positive and negative forces fin

vocabulary.definition: characterized by conflict, disorder, or confusion; not controlled or calm
vocabulary.example: The turbulent waters made it difficult for the boats to navigate.

vocabulary.definition: unable to be seen; not visible to the eye
vocabulary.example: The invisible ink only appeared when heated.

vocabulary.definition: the ability of a material to conduct heat or electricity
vocabulary.example: Metals have high conductivity, allowing electricity to flow easily through them.

vocabulary.definition: an ionized gas consisting of positive ions and free electrons in proportions resulting in more or less no overall electric charge
vocabulary.example: Plasma TVs use electrically charged gas to create images.

vocabulary.definition: a sharp change of pressure in a narrow region traveling through a medium, especially air, caused by explosion or other disturbance
vocabulary.example: The shockwave from the explosion shattered windows in nearby buildings.

vocabulary.definition: a unit of energy equal to one billion joules
vocabulary.example: The power plant generated over 10 gigajoules of electricity in a single day.
